<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RESTAURANTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/10/restaurants-struggling-hire-staff-lockdowns-lift?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
So You Think You Can Fold a Burrito
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/10/restaurants-struggling-hire-staff-lockdowns-lift" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="An illustration of a white plate on a baby blue background. Rice grains are sprinkled on the plate, forming the words " we're hiring."" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MDQzL3dlX3JlX2hpcmluZy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Chipotle is more desperate to get your attention now than when it partnered with Shawn Mendes. The burrito chain <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/10/chipotle-to-hike-wages-debut-referral-bonuses-amid-tight-labor-market.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> yesterday that it's bumping up employee wages to an average of $15/hr by the end of June and wants to hire 20,000 workers total. It also introduced a path for employees to hit a $100,000/year salary as a manager in just 3.5 years.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Restaurants are really hurting for workers. And while there are plenty of hot takes trying to explain why the food service industry is so understaffed, one thing is certain: Patio season is in danger. The industry lost a total of <a href="https://www.restaurantdive.com/news/now-hiring-how-the-labor-shortage-is-squeezing-full-service-restaurants/599453/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">2.5 million jobs</a> in 2020, and only gained about 442,000 jobs back in Q1.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What's going on? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The April jobs report released last Friday <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/07/april-jobs-report-big-whiff-us-economy?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">badly missed targets</a>, showing that there's widespread disconnect between the number of jobs open and the available labor force. It appears that the restaurant industry in particular just isn't all that attractive for people looking for work.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some restaurant owners are pointing to beefed up unemployment benefits during the pandemic to explain why employees don't want to get back on payroll. But would-be employees are <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/05/10/economy/labor-shortages-pay-gaps/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pointing</a> to other factors. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Restaurants have elevated sanitation requirements, plenty of food supply chain issues, and an average annual salary of only </span><span><a href="https://www.ziprecruiter.com/Salaries/Restaurant-Worker-Salary?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$21,470</a></span><span> to serve brunch crowds that have been locked inside for a year.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Some fast-food joints were </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/DevitaDavison/status/1391415254710632448?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">forced to shutter</a></span><span> after employees, who were protesting working conditions, walked out. And New York City is </span><span><a href="https://www.jacobinmag.com/2021/05/chipotle-workers-fair-workweek-law-nyc?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">suing</a></span><span> Chipotle for $450 million over nearly 600,000 separate violations of workers' rights.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>demand for eating out will only increase over the summer, so restaurant chains are <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/25/darden-restaurants-raising-wages-sign-sales?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raising pay</a> and finding other creative methods to recruit workers. Taco Bell held outdoor "hiring parties" in April, and this week, Chipotle is holding a virtual career fair on Discord.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/10/darkside-group-behind-colonial-pipeline-hack-speaks?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
DarkSide, Yesterday
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/10/darkside-group-behind-colonial-pipeline-hack-speaks" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Mistake GIF" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=381 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3oEjHGnY8oB4BHVTP2/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Mistake GIF" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3oEjHGnY8oB4BHVTP2/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">DarkSide, the cyber-criminal group whose <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/business-57050690?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hacking activities</a> took the US' largest gasoline pipeline offline for four days, said it felt kinda bad about disrupting the flow of fuel to critical hubs on the East Coast. In a statement <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/business-57050690?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">posted</a> to its website yesterday, DarkSide said it was "apolitical" and emphasized it was the anti-Joker: "Our goal is to make money, and not creating problems for society." </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The problem with that logic is, DarkSide's business is selling ransomware that gets used to hack companies.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In the future, DarkSide says it'll pay closer attention to clients' intended targets. It already has a stance against hacking hospitals, schools, mortuary services, nonprofits, and governments. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Can't fix a pipeline problem overnight</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the pipeline's operator, Colonial, said it's <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/10/colonial-says-parts-of-fuel-pipeline-being-brought-online-aims-to-restore-service-by-end-of-week.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hoping</a> to bring the full system back online by the end of the week. In the interim, the government relaxed rules so more oil can be driven up the East Coast in tankers. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Crude prices rose about 1% yesterday, so price impacts are still minimal...so far. But if the shutdown takes longer than expected to resolve, GasBuddy analysts <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/05/09/business/gas-price-spike-fears/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">predict</a> gas prices could rise more than a few cents.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/10/attorneys-general-ask-facebook-drop-plans-instagram-kids?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Hey Facebook: Maybe Don't Do It for the Children
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, a group of 44 attorneys general <a href="https://apnews.com/article/business-technology-health-6037e41eb78c258c8151db24ddd66551?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">asked</a> Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg to ditch plans to develop an Instagram platform for children younger than 13, the current age cutoff for FB services.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The reasoning:</strong> If they've still got training wheels, they're too young to navigate treacherous digital sidewalks filled with cyberbullies and online predators. The AGs cited studies showing that social media negatively impacts youngsters' physical and emotional health, and expressed concerns about Facebook's previous shortcomings in protecting society's youngest members. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Exhibit A: the 20 million images of child sexual abuse </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/10/attorneys-general-ask-facebook-to-abandon-instagram-for-kids-plans.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a></span><span> on FB platforms last year. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Facebook's response?<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>The company said InstaKids would have more parental controls, no advertising, and be crafted with input from privacy and child safety experts.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Just because you <em>can</em> make a product for kids doesn't mean you <em>should</em>. "It appears that Facebook is not responding to a need, but instead creating one, as this platform appeals primarily to children who otherwise do not or would not have an Instagram account," the attorneys general wrote.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY PIESTRO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
*Pizza-Based Orchestra Music Swells*
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.piestro.com/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=0511" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Piestro" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvMzM1Mi8xNjIwMTU0NTQ5LVNhbnRhTW9uaWNhX0Vudmlyb25tZW50YWxfdjJfXzFfLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6ImNvbWV0LW1vcm5pbmdicmV3IiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Dawn breaks over the ocean. You think your eyes are deceiving you. You say to yourself, <em>No, it cannot be.</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But it’s true. There atop the golden sands sits <strong style="color:#000">Piestro, the autonomous pizzeria </strong>that makes pies at a fraction of the cost of traditional pizzerias.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Suddenly Piestro says, “Good morning. I would like to offer you <strong style="color:#000">the opportunity</strong> to <a href="https://www.piestro.com/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=0511" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">invest in me</a>.” The breeze carries Piestro’s robot words to your ears. “The US pizza market is set to grow to <strong style="color:#000">$54 billion by 2023</strong>, and I will disrupt it with my <strong style="color:#000">delicious efficiency</strong>.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It doesn’t make sense that you’re having a conversation with a robot pizza maker; then again, the robot pizza maker is making a lot of sense. So you reply, “OK Piestro, <a href="https://www.piestro.com/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=0511" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">take my money</a>. Take my money and go be <strong style="color:#000">the future of the booming pizza industry</strong>.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“Thank you,” says Piestro, “And goodbye. Time to <a href="https://www.piestro.com/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=0511" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">get that dough</a>.”</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

Key Performance Indicators

</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Lintao Zhang/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Nearly 60% of people in Japan want the upcoming Olympic Games <a href="https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/poll-shows-60-japanese-want-games-cancelled-2021-05-10/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">canceled</a>, according to a new poll. Host city Tokyo is under a state of emergency through the end of the month due to a Covid-19 outbreak, and Japan has the lowest vaccination rate among wealthy nations.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>"It was like a cancel culture kind of a thing so they're reviewing it." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Trainer Bob Baffert told Fox News he would <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2021/may/10/bob-baffert-medina-spirit-kentucky-derby-horse-racing-cancel-culture-disqualification?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">still run Medina Spirit</a> in the Preakness Stakes on Saturday, despite the horse having failed its drug test after winning the Kentucky Derby. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>A juicy profile of Robinhood and its promise to democratize investing. (<a href="https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2021/05/17/robinhoods-big-gamble?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">New Yorker</a>)</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/10/nbc-says-wont-air-golden-globes-2022?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Golden Globes Will Have to Find Its Own Ride Home
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/10/nbc-says-wont-air-golden-globes-2022" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Gif of five different 2021 Golden Globes nominees in Zoom chat windows" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=366 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/cDiPRArTjzmcUp0vR2/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Gif of five different 2021 Golden Globes nominees in Zoom chat windows" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/cDiPRArTjzmcUp0vR2/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">NBC said yesterday that it <a href="https://variety.com/2021/tv/awards/golden-globes-nbc-2022-1234969976/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">won't air</a> the Golden Globes until the Hollywood Foreign Press Association (HFPA) cleans up its act, which means the 2022 show is currently without a broadcast home.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The context:</strong> The HFPA, an 87-member organization that votes on TV and movie awards, was the focus of a February report in the LA Times that found the group had zero Black members and was doing <a href="https://people.com/movies/golden-globes-hfpa-has-zero-black-members/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sketchy things</a>, like flying to lavish parties for <em>Emily in Paris</em>—a series that received two Golden Globe nominations despite low critical approval. The report also found that its own members collected ~$2 million in payments from the organization.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Other companies like Netflix and Amazon have already spoken out against the HFPA's recent (and, to them, unsatisfactory) plan to address its lack of diversity and ethical gray areas, but NBC's decision may force the HFPA to get a real move on.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Despite this year's low viewer count and technical difficulties, the Golden Globes still supplies a significant chunk of change for HFPA. In 2018, the association signed a $60 million licensing deal with NBC to air the ceremony, which still ranks among the most popular non-sports shows on TV.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">

Rice grains are sprinkled on the plate, forming the words \"we're hiring.\"\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MDQzL3dlX3JlX2hpcmluZy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eChipotle is more desperate to get your attention now than when it partnered with Shawn Mendes. The burrito chain \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/10/chipotle-to-hike-wages-debut-referral-bonuses-amid-tight-labor-market.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e yesterday that it's bumping up employee wages to an average of $15/hr by the end of June and wants to hire 20,000 workers total. It also introduced a path for employees to hit a $100,000/year salary as a manager in just 3.5 years.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eRestaurants are really hurting for workers. And while there are plenty of hot takes trying to explain why the food service industry is so understaffed, one thing is certain: Patio season is in danger. The industry lost a total of \u003ca href=\"https://www.restaurantdive.com/news/now-hiring-how-the-labor-shortage-is-squeezing-full-service-restaurants/599453/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e2.5 million jobs\u003c/a\u003e in 2020, and only gained about 442,000 jobs back in Q1.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat's going on? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe April jobs report released last Friday \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/07/april-jobs-report-big-whiff-us-economy?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebadly missed targets\u003c/a\u003e, showing that there's widespread disconnect between the number of jobs open and the available labor force. It appears that the restaurant industry in particular just isn't all that attractive for people looking for work.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome restaurant owners are pointing to beefed up unemployment benefits during the pandemic to explain why employees don't want to get back on payroll. But would-be employees are \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/05/10/economy/labor-shortages-pay-gaps/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epointing\u003c/a\u003e to other factors. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eRestaurants have elevated sanitation requirements, plenty of food supply chain issues, and an average annual salary of only \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ziprecruiter.com/Salaries/Restaurant-Worker-Salary?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$21,470\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to serve brunch crowds that have been locked inside for a year.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eSome fast-food joints were \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/DevitaDavison/status/1391415254710632448?s=20\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eforced to shutter\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e after employees, who were protesting working conditions, walked out. And New York City is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.jacobinmag.com/2021/05/chipotle-workers-fair-workweek-law-nyc?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esuing\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Chipotle for $450 million over nearly 600,000 separate violations of workers' rights.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003edemand for eating out will only increase over the summer, so restaurant chains are \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/25/darden-restaurants-raising-wages-sign-sales?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eraising pay\u003c/a\u003e and finding other creative methods to recruit workers. Taco Bell held outdoor \"hiring parties\" in April, and this week, Chipotle is holding a virtual career fair on Discord.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDarkSide, the cyber-criminal group whose \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/business-57050690?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehacking activities\u003c/a\u003e took the US' largest gasoline pipeline offline for four days, said it felt kinda bad about disrupting the flow of fuel to critical hubs on the East Coast. In a statement \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/business-57050690?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eposted\u003c/a\u003e to its website yesterday, DarkSide said it was \"apolitical\" and emphasized it was the anti-Joker: \"Our goal is to make money, and not creating problems for society.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe problem with that logic is, DarkSide's business is selling ransomware that gets used to hack companies.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn the future, DarkSide says it'll pay closer attention to clients' intended targets. It already has a stance against hacking hospitals, schools, mortuary services, nonprofits, and governments. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eCan't fix a pipeline problem overnight\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the pipeline's operator, Colonial, said it's \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/10/colonial-says-parts-of-fuel-pipeline-being-brought-online-aims-to-restore-service-by-end-of-week.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehoping\u003c/a\u003e to bring the full system back online by the end of the week. In the interim, the government relaxed rules so more oil can be driven up the East Coast in tankers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCrude prices rose about 1% yesterday, so price impacts are still minimal...so far. But if the shutdown takes longer than expected to resolve, GasBuddy analysts \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/05/09/business/gas-price-spike-fears/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epredict\u003c/a\u003e gas prices could rise more than a few \u003c/strong\u003eThe company said InstaKids would have more parental controls, no advertising, and be crafted with input from privacy and child safety experts.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e Just because you \u003cem\u003ecan\u003c/em\u003e make a product style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNBC said yesterday that it \u003ca href=\"https://variety.com/2021/tv/awards/golden-globes-nbc-2022-1234969976/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewon't air\u003c/a\u003e the Golden Globes until the Hollywood Foreign Press Association (HFPA) cleans up its act, which means the 2022 show is currently without a broadcast home.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe context:\u003c/strong\u003e The HFPA, an 87-member organization that votes on TV and movie awards, was the focus of a February report in the LA Times that found the group had zero Black members and was doing \u003ca href=\"https://people.com/movies/golden-globes-hfpa-has-zero-black-members/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esketchy things\u003c/a\u003e, like flying to lavish parties for \u003cem\u003eEmily in Paris\u003c/em\u003e—a series that received two Golden Globe nominations despite low critical approval. The report also found that its own members collected ~$2 million in payments from the organization.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOther companies like Netflix and Amazon have already spoken out against the HFPA's recent (and, to them, unsatisfactory) plan to address its lack of diversity and ethical gray areas, but NBC's decision may force the HFPA to get a real move on.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Despite this year's low viewer count and technical difficulties, the Golden Globes still supplies a significant chunk of change for HFPA. In 2018, the association signed a $60 million licensing deal with NBC to air the ceremony, which still ranks among the most popular non-sports shows on TV.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS
